programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the Golds uncover a series of bogus pawns, their investigation leads to a trusted employee and a confession. Reality series about the running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth visit a customer with a garage full of vintage cars. Against his children's wishes, Les offers big money for one of the owner's golden oldies.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the mysterious origins of mummification and any possible influences exerted by extraterrestrials with a superior knowledge of science and engineering.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the locations of stargate portals around the world, which some people believe to be doorways to wormholes in time.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: An insight into the secrets surrounding the 10 biggest and most mysterious conspiracies in history, including the goings-on at Area 51.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With Les and Seth away at the Autorama car show - and Ashley in charge of the store - the employees go a little crazy. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Karen tries to make peace between Seth and Ashley, Bobby J takes a two-story tractor for a spin and a watch snob riles Seth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to buy one of the quietest aircraft ever made. They also consider purchasing a famous casino chip called 'the one arm bandit' and a signed New York Yankees jersey.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to purchase a Grammy trophy and a rare 1930s cola cooler. Later, a couple bring along a rickshaw that used to carry tigers in the Siegfried & Roy stage show.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry adopts a disguise at an auction in Stanton, while Darrell gets himself banned from bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Moreno Valley, where Casey and Rene acquire the perfect locker and Darrell's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen face their toughest challenge yet when two old rivals join forces, and the guys find an off-road motorcycle and a pair of net guns.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Big Sis revamp the shop to help bring in more customers. Plus, Allen unearths a set of antique basketballs, and goes toe-to-toe with an NBA Hall of Famer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Experts consider the possible effects of an eruption of the volcano in Yellowstone Park in America, which could lead to starvation, epidemics and social chaos.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the CIA's rumoured investment in psychological operations, asking if there could be an army of remote viewers watching the American public today.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating evidence that suggests the US military has been under attack from aliens for the past 50 years, asking if a huge secret could be being kept out of the public eye.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos examines the notion that extraterrestrials could have left clues to the universe's mysteries. Experts investigate cryptic puzzles that might have been placed by ancient aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. A ventriloquist leaves Karen and Bobby J speechless, and an angry mixed martial arts fighter takes a swing at Byron.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds' million-dollar art deal takes more twists and turns, but eventually Les shakes hands on the single biggest purchase in store history.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have the opportunity of a lifetime when they stumble upon pieces of art that could be worth millions. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hands out his biggest loan ever on a luxurious Rolls Royce, hoping this latest gamble will pay off and not leave his ego in tatters.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen are in Nashville, Tennessee, where they meet a band of tough, high-bidding bikers before discovering a 37mm anti-tank gun and a cowboy's rodeo saddle.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Big Sis reveals bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit at an auction. Meanwhile, Ton and Allen unearth a Native American tomahawk.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy cross the Irish Sea to the north of England, where destinations include Manchester United's Old Trafford, the home of one of Ireland's sporting greats - George Best.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Bogart tries to get his father in shape in time for his wedding. Meanwhile, Roy brings a mime to an auction in Corktown.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: The buyers have high hopes for a container auction in a town named Utopia, but it remains to be seen whether they will uncover any household treasures worth celebrating.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Ivy battle it out at a locker auction in Lancaster, California, while Jarrod and Brandi buy some DJ equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Placentia, California, where Rene and Casey buy a locker full of luggage. Meanwhile, Barry is left pondering his future.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan and Phil Wang play a series of video games, including Rayman, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Time Crisis 5, and Let's Get Freddie To Rumble.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that may be the truth or may be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Rhod Gilbert and Hal Cruttenden, interior designer and former Dragons' Den investor Kelly Hoppen and TV host and number-cruncher Carol Vorderman.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Johnny Vegas, Ronni Ancona and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'naval navigation' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Broadcaster and writer Danny Baker, sport presenter Gabby Logan, Citizen Khan creator and star Adil Ray and historian Kate Williams join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Alex, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. In the first episode, the Richardsons decide to throw a huge birthday party for their daughter, Elsie.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Dr Johnson seeks Prince George's support in publishing his new dictionary, but brainless Baldrick burns the only copy. Edmund sets out to save the English language by rewriting the great man's masterpiece - but he has only one night to complete it. Comedy, guest starring Robbie Coltrane, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: After Edmund scorns the exploits of the Scarlet Pimpernel, two noblemen bet him 1,000 guineas that he can't go to France and rescue an aristocrat. Instead, he finds the Comte de Frou Frou at Mrs Miggins' pie shop and takes him to the French embassy, but ends up being arrested by a revolutionary who has assassinated the ambassador. Comedy, guest starring Nigel Planer, Tim McInnerny and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Exploring the Ngorongoro crater in northern Tanzania, considered to be one of Africa's most treasured wonders, including a look at the wildlife that inhabits the area.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A look back at how supporting characters including Boycie and Trigger developed over the years. Featuring contributions from cast members and famous fans.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Devious royal butler Edmund Blackadder steps in to foil a plan by new prime minister Pitt the Younger to bankrupt his master the Prince Regent - but as usual his intentions are not particularly honourable. Rowan Atkinson, Hugh Laurie and Tony Robinson star.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Dr Johnson seeks Prince George's support in publishing his new dictionary, but brainless Baldrick burns the only copy. Edmund sets out to save the English language by rewriting the great man's masterpiece - but he has only one night to complete it. Comedy, guest starring Robbie Coltrane, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: After Edmund scorns the exploits of the Scarlet Pimpernel, two noblemen bet him 1,000 guineas that he can't go to France and rescue an aristocrat. Instead, he finds the Comte de Frou Frou at Mrs Miggins' pie shop and takes him to the French embassy, but ends up being arrested by a revolutionary who has assassinated the ambassador. Comedy, guest starring Nigel Planer, Tim McInnerny and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah arrives in Paris, hoping to reconnect with her husband, and is shocked by what she finds. Elizabeth pushes George to be truthful, but causes more damage to their already fragile relationship. Regina puts the next stage of her plan into action, and while Anna finds out the truth about her real father, Olivia proves the depths she is prepared to go to in order to save her marriage.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah returns to Inverness with Rene, but may have underestimated her feelings for George. Olivia finds the burden of deception weighs heavily, while Anna and Gino prepare for their wedding day.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. A DNA sample seems to rule out cabbie David Russo as the murderer of nurse Manisha Devi - until it transpires that he has cancer and recently underwent a blood transfusion that could have affected the test result. Peter Baxter is stabbed by a traumatised Ruth Cohen, while June has a run-in with a 13-year-old arson suspect and later calls the station to report a rape - naming herself as victim.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra supervises Diane as he covers for Ric for a fortnight, and reveals he would be keen to work at the hospital permanently - but his determination to perform an operation tempts him to bend the rules, and ruins his chances. Tricia tells Chrissie about her relationship with Mark, and decides to have her surgery moved forward.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Josh and Penny are called to deliver a baby in unusual circumstances, and Max faces his worst nightmare as his son is brought in for emergency treatment. Meanwhile, identical twins are reunited for the first time in 28 years by an accident. Medical drama, starring Ian Bleasdale and Donna Alexander.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Teenage rapist Ross Trescot is brought into custody, but his arrest does little to comfort June, who insists in being interviewed by Sheelagh, unable to bear the thought of reliving her ordeal with a stranger. Yvonne also faces a stressful time as she gives evidence at the inquest into Lee Thomas's death. Colleagues support her during the day, but a verdict of unlawful killing is recorded and she faces the unsettling prospect of being charged with murder. Away from the line of duty, Phil Hunter grows increasingly uneasy as Kate plans their wedding and finally admits he is still married to Cindy - prompting her to throw him out of the house.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur frets over not being able to see his son after the fall out of Pauline finding out about his affair. Michelle confront Ms. Hewitt about wreaking her parents marriage.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur and Chrissy are both having marriage problems. Will Adrian and Mandy get jobs to put food on the table. Sanjay know Geetas sister Meena is up to no good!.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch return to the scene of a fire in the basement of a house converted into bedsits. Meanwhile, Recall says goodbye to his family as they move to Scotland without him.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul's errant uncle Donald MacDonald returns to Glenbogle after a 40-year absence, but his homecoming receives a mixed reaction. Lexie sets out to forget her marital problems by organising Molly's 60th birthday party, but the matriarch is not so keen to celebrate. Meanwhile, Isobel faces financial ruin after a contract to supply the estate with fresh bread and vegetables is cancelled, and Jess is concerned that she and Duncan are turning into a boring couple. Drama, guest starring Tom Baker, with Lloyd Owen, Susan Hampshire and Dawn Steele.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Karen is subjected to a horrific assault by the grandson of a pensioner in her care, while Luke gets into trouble at school and responds by running away, plunging Anna into a panic. On a happier note, Tom clinches an important business deal with German client Herr Gruber, while Joe contemplates moving in with Beth. Leslie Ash, Julian Lewis Jones and Lesley Dunlop star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey makes an appointment with a Harley Street specialist, hoping to allay her suspicions that she may be pregnant. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. Make-up is found in Tyler's room, and his parents are relieved to be told he has a girlfriend - until it transpires she is also his teacher. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Jack Doolan star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is looking forward to the pitter-patter of tiny feet - despite the fact that daughter Judith is not even pregnant.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo tracks down his missing ferret to Nora's washing basket, but smuggling it out unnoticed proves tricky. Bill Owen and Kathy Staff star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate when young lawyer Emily Proctor is found axed to death in Hyde Park. They are led to the chambers of a human rights barrister who was having an affair with her, and it isn't long before the victim's seedy double life involving Internet porn and dark family secrets emerges. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Samuel West.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack announces he is quitting the team, but before Sandra, Brian and Gerry can question his reasons, shadowy Whitehall figure Stephen Fisher arrives with one of his secret cases - the unsolved murder of a woman dating back more than 160 years. With just 24 hours to solve it, will the sleuths find time to get to the bottom of Jack's shock decision and persuade him to stick around?.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a DNA match between a medical student reported missing six years previously and a corpse that was found at around the same time. Investigations into the man's background reveal he had been suspected of having links to terrorist organisations - but Boyd believes a high-level cover-up is obscuring the whole truth about the case. Guest starring Don Warrington.

programme.title: The Magic Singles of the Week
programme.desc: These are the top 20 songs we're loving right now. Stay tuned for a delicious mix of today's feel-good favourites and a huge dollop of laidback loveliness straight from the Magic HQ.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in turning water into whisky, and how preparations are made to cope with another natural disaster on the scale of Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys a run-down Porsche 928, which leaves Edd China doubtful about their chances of getting the car back on the road again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer meets the proud owner of a Porsche 928 which is in good condition, while Edd China adds the finishing touches to the restoration project.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton uncovers plans for the D-Day invasion. Plus, he experiences a bumpy landing for a Dakota aeroplane, and in France his passion hits new heights with a parachute jump.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr is stunned when his father serves him with another lawsuit. Rumours circulate of a crisis at OCC's HQ, while in the shop, Paul Sr's team is unable to agree on its new build.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: The technology behind the world's most powerful earthmovers, looking at enormous dumper trucks and diggers.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe cleans the grinder on a fish processing boat in the Bering Sea, then faces the unnerving task of peeling wood at a sawmill.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind sanders, solid terrain models, Stucco and high-speed roll-up doors, and how techniques have developed over time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Pressed Glass/Pickup Truck Caps/Alpaca Yarn/Utility Knives
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, examining how pressed glass, pick-up truck cabs, alpaca yarn and utility knives are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The design and manufacture of the Transit, Ford's ubiquitous white van, and the full-length, all-weather riding coats produced by Driza-Bone.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland travel to the Isle of Wight where they test out an '80s Ford sportscar. Plus, they get a taste of Hollywood glamour behind the wheel of a legendary Alfa Romeo.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Jake Harris is given an important lesson on driving the Cornelia Marie, and disaster strikes on board the Wizard when one of the crewmen becomes caught in the line.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The crew takes advantage of a break in the weather to seize its share of the trade, but the tight time line could force members to take dangerous risks.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV in the south of France. However, with age comes problems, and expert mechanic Edd China needs to strip it back to its bare bones to breathe new life into the vehicle, as almost every aspect of the quirky car requires attention.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Part two of two. Wayne Carini continues his trip to Amelia Island in Florida, where rare vehicles are being purchased by European collectors at an auction of vintage motorcars.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini tries to find the original owner of an abandoned 1972 Ferrari Daytona Spyder.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How pizza is made for soldiers on the frontline, and the process of making the world's smoothest writing ballpoint pens that don't leak or fade.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make modern violins that sound as good as the legendary Stradivarius. Plus, how houses are built out of volcanic rock.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: A dark cloud hangs over the crews after their friend and fellow abalone diver, Greg Pickering, is attacked by a great white. Bucky tries to avoid bankruptcy.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Kodiak's crane breaks, resulting in an injury that forces a crew member to retire to his bunk. Meanwhile, a rookie fisherman has a breakdown on board the Seabrooke.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton acquires an extremely rare - and valuable - German Panther tank - and its original undercoat is more pink than camouflage. However, getting parts is a struggle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard unearths a steel corpus of Christ on the cross, and spots a divine early 19th-century gothic pew. Later, he finds a set of 1950s industrial pendant lamps.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: In Anglesey antique dealer Saxon Durrant charms leather craftsman Martin Ashworth with an incredibly rare and impressive vintage 1920s Louis Vuitton wardrobe trunk.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys a run-down Porsche 928, which leaves Edd China doubtful about their chances of getting the car back on the road again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer meets the proud owner of a Porsche 928 which is in good condition, while Edd China adds the finishing touches to the restoration project.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Dorset, Drew Pritchard visits a showroom full of mid-20th century items, including a pair of 1960s Danish leather chairs. He also visits an Austin Healey and Porsche classic car restorer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Top salvage expert Drew Pritchard breaks new ground with his first-ever buying trip to Northern Ireland, where he gets 'trollied' and falls for a vintage Japanese item.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Salesman Mike Brewer and mechanic Ant Anstead take on a 1987 Alfa Romeo Spider Quadrifoglio with a rare hard-top. The car needs extensive repairs, including a rebuild of the propshaft.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Jay brings Dan a 2012 Camaro ZL1 with poor performance and a blown supercharger. Plus, Terry brings in a high-powered restomod of a 1931 Landau Phaeton.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How cars absorb the impact of a crash, the processes involved in printing a blockbuster, and how vegetable oil is used to make spread.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in designing cars that offer the maximum protection in a crash. Plus, how books are printed.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a racially motivated serial killer - a sniper who murdered at least 20 African-American men but left few clues and no witnesses. A countrywide appeal eventually yielded the number of a Kentucky number plate, and led police to white supremacist Joseph Paul Franklin - who promptly escaped custody. He was finally arrested two months later, having made his way to Tampa, Florida.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How splinters of bone helped forensic investigators to trace a murderer four years after the victim first disappeared.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a mother failed to return home from work on a winter's night. As dawn broke, her murdered body was found in a nearby churchyard, and CCTV was called upon to solve the mystery of her death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Bridgett Frisbie, who was lured to woodland near her Texas home town in April 2011 and shot dead. Her friend Alex Olivieri killed the teenager to prevent her revealing her knowledge of an earlier crime in which he was involved.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is alerted when a female Army officer fails to report for work and a mysterious bloodstain is found at her home. Her husband comes under suspicion of murder because of his violent history, but the investigators find little evidence to implicate him.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA's cruelty investigators are called to an affluent suburb in the Houston area to rescue horses from a property. However, for some animals, help has come too late.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown x-rays a dog and confirms she is expecting puppies, before helping the animal through labour.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to sedate a pig so he can replace its broken nose ring, but the task proves much harder than expected.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Comora hunts for a glamorous gown with the help of a celebrity consultant, and Randy tries to find two dresses to satisfy a customer with expensive taste.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A soon-to-be-married woman's best friend is furious about her decision to appoint a man as her 'male of honour'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride sets out to find a green dress that matches her emerald engagement ring, and to complicate matters she is determined it has to be the exact same shade.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown visits the USA, where he meets a woman with the largest collection of pet cats he has ever seen and an eccentric skateboarding dog.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown deals with an oversexed rabbit that is giving out some unwanted attention. He also tries to outsmart Splodge, a dog with a knack of escaping from his owner's garden.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Max Mixson puts his life at risk during an armed siege when he tries to rescue more than 100 dogs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCA Investigator Barbra Christiansen responds to a call involving what sounds like a serious case of cat overcrowding - one house and 35 cats.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police investigate two crimes of passion, one featuring a man who was shot dead in his home, and another in which a football player and his girlfriend were beaten to death.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of millionaire Bob Harrod, who finally married his childhood sweetheart Fontelle at the age of 81. While she was making preparations to move from Missouri to join her new husband at his California house in July 2009, he vanished from outside the property, and though his car keys were taken the vehicle itself remained in the drive.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Hatice Corbacioglu, who vanished in June 2009 while visiting lover Riza Cosa in New York. The plot thickened when Cosa fled to his native Turkey and the body of his wife was was found stuffed in a bag in a New York steel factory where he had worked. A year later, in an apparent suicide, Cosa fell to his death from a tall building,.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How the analysis of insects found on dead bodies can be used to calculate time of death, and even offer clues to the victim's identity.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli reveals how a bridal appointment entourage can make or break a woman's chances of getting her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli reveals the 10 biggest blunders a bride can make when shopping for her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli counts down his favourite dresses for big-spending brides shopping at the top end of the market.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.sub-title: Top 10 Things to Know Before Buying a Dress
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli reveals the things every bride should know before shopping for a wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.sub-title: Top 10 Men in a Bride's World
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli counts down the top 10 men in a bride's world, from a father crying tears of joy and a brother vetoing all low-cut options, to an opinionated fashionista friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli looks back at larger-than-life brides, the outlandish dresses they requested and how the salon dealt with their over-the-top demands.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals are given 800 euros to spend at a market in the French city of Annecy. Jonah takes a saw and electric drill to an antique cabinet, Katie shows how simple upholstery can be and property developer Vanessa hopes to transfer her money-making expertise to homeware.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants 10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Forty four-year-old Erica binges on food when faced with adversity, and previous weight-loss surgery was unsuccessful. Can she get the support she needs to change her habits?.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personalities of some of the world's most infamous murderers, beginning with serial killer Fred West, who was charged with 12 murders in 1994 after police discovered the remains of nine bodies at his home in Gloucester. Though he committed suicide before he could be tried for the crimes, his wife Rosemary was convicted of killing 10 women and girls in November 1995.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1976, a woman was left for dead in her home in California. Despite a major manhunt, the killer avoided detection for over 40 years, until DNA analysis was applied to evidence.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case in which a couple, recently engaged, were found brutally murdered in a car. Footage from a surveillance camera gave the police their first break.
